SecondaryOutcomeDescription: The functional evaluation will be assessed by using a scoring system named LEFS (Lower Extremity Functional Scale). LEFS is a widely known and validated patient-reported outcome measures (PROM) comprising 20 questions that is used to assess lower extremity functions. The patients will be asked to rate the activity listed from 0 to 4 (0 refers to an extreme difficulty/unable to perform activity, while 4 refers to having no difficulty at all). A higher score (maximum 80 points) indicates a very high function (i.e., a more favorable outcome).
